name: JPMorgan Chase
title: ML Center of Excellence with Rapid Cycles

classification.classificationRationale: Textbook Hub-and-Spoke (Model 4): centralized ML CoE (200+ ML scientists, software engineers, product managers across 3 continents) serves as the hub, distributing LLM Suite to 250K employees across all business divisions (spokes). Led by Chief Analytics Officer Derek Waldron. 8-week iteration cadence for platform updates. Multi-model architecture (OpenAI + Anthropic). Structural orientation: named CoE with dedicated C-suite leadership, formal budget ($18B tech investment), and explicit mandate.

description:
A centralized Machine Learning Center of Excellence with 200+ ML scientists, software engineers, and product managers positioned globally across three continents. Distinctive for its rapid iteration cadence.
- LLM Suite deployed to 250,000 employees (entire workforce except branch and call center staff)
- Half use it roughly every day
- 'Every eight weeks, LLM Suite is updated as the bank feeds it more from the vast databases and software applications of its major businesses, giving the platform more abilities'
- Multi-model architecture using both OpenAI and Anthropic—creating optionality and avoiding vendor lock-in
- Led by Chief Analytics Officer Derek Waldron (former McKinsey partner with PhD in computational physics)

observableMarkers.metrics: Vision: 'The JPMorgan Chase of the future is going to be a fully AI-connected enterprise.' Plans include AI agents for every employee, automation of every behind-the-scenes process, and AI concierges for every client experience.

mechanisms.name: Deploy to Thousands Before You Know What Works
mechanisms.evidence: LLM Suite deployed to 250,000 employees (entire workforce except branch/call center). Updated every 8 weeks with new capabilities. Half the workforce uses it roughly every day. This is massive-scale deployment with rapid iteration—deploying first, then feeding more data and capabilities iteratively.

mechanisms.name: Put Executives on Tools
mechanisms.evidence: LLM Suite deployed to entire workforce including senior leadership. CEO Jamie Dimon's public vision: "The JPMorgan Chase of the future is going to be a fully AI-connected enterprise." CEO-level commitment to AI transformation suggests executive tool adoption.

layers.label: Curation Review
layers.summary: Model 4 (Hybrid/Hub-and-Spoke) validated with high conviction. JPMorgan has a centralized ML CoE (200+ ML scientists) that serves the entire enterprise via LLM Suite deployed to 250K employees. This is textbook hub-and-spoke: central AI capability hub distributing to business division spokes. Structural orientation confirmed: named CoE with dedicated Chief Analytics Officer (Derek Waldron), formal resources, 8-week iteration cadence. Fixed industry from Technology to Financial Services. Added Mechanism #5 (Deploy to Thousands) with strengthened evidence. Added Mechanism #7 (Put Executives on Tools).

layers.label: Latest Update
layers.summary: JPMorgan has begun deploying agentic AI to handle complex multistep tasks. contingencies.regulatoryIntensity: High. Banking is heavily regulated; AI deployment must navigate compliance, risk, and audit requirements. Remarkable that JPMorgan achieves 8-week cycles despite this.
